intro: Daviesia ulicina f. communis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed Daviesia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and clusters of small, pea-like flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in Mediterranean climates. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators and supporting local biodiversity.
